text:
hey guys so we just picked a jackfruit off of the 
tree in our backyard so I thought I would show you

what how to open it I'm not gonna open it cuz I 
don't actually know how but my mom's gonna open

it and we'll show you what a whole jackfruit 
looks like so here it is mr. jackfruit it's

a relatively small one because it's home grown so 
we're basically just making a random cut into the

fruit at this point I should say that we're not 
professionals you know we're just kind of opening

it the way we know how I'm sure the pros do it a 
lot more proficiently Wow so there it is there's

a jackfruit cut open in half we're now going to 
actually quarter it there we go okay now we're

going to remove that core in the middle which is 
not edible so as you can see the knife is really

messed up with all the SAP so we're gonna have 
to rub the knife with oil and the oil help remove

that sticky SAP afterwards all right and there we 
go the core comes out and here's another view and

you can see the fruit actually has a very high 
yield it's packed with edible flesh if you opens

it you can see that it just sort of naturally 
separates into individual sections and now we

have to take it and remove sort of the membranes 
that live in between the pieces because they're

you know there are the pieces but there's like 
these little things that we don't eat so now my

mom's going to take over and remove the individual 
jackfruit pieces so by the way it's very sticky so

your hands are going to inevitably be very sticky 
afterwards so now she's just peeling off those

membranes and it might be kind of hard to to see 
right now like what exactly she peeling off but

it'll be very obvious because the piece is intact 
in one whole piece and now she's removing the sea

and there's one there is one whole piece of 
jackfruit there's another one and the seeds

you can actually save and then we boil it and eat 
it and it's really kind of nutty and starchy and

it makes sort of a fun snack so don't throw 
the seeds away if you get a chance to open

a whole jackfruit alright I'm going to try one 
and let's see how good it is hmm for those of

you who've never had jackfruit it's got a very 
strong and distinct smell it's not like durian

where you know a lot of people find it stinky I 
actually think this is a pleasant smell but it

is strong and pungent it's chewy it's quite 
fibrous so you gotta chew it a little bit a

little juicy some can be a little drier and 
crunchy but the riper it is the juicier it

is it's really quite filling so I only eat 
like a couple of these and then I'm done but

it's really cool really interesting if you're in 
Thailand a lot of times at supermarkets they'll

have these peeled all ready to go so you don't 
have to go through the whole process so make

sure you pick one up and give it a try hope you 
enjoyed that and if you have opened a jacquard

before and if I would love to know what you 
think about jackford or how you like to eat

it and you've got different interesting ways 
of eating or cooking with it let me know bye
